title: Get Lectured: University of Waterloo, Fall '24
author: Josh Niland
excerpt: The University of Waterloo’s School of Architecture has shared its Arriscraft Canada Brick Speaker Series information for the Fall 2024 semester. Upcoming events include a panel discussion on 'Climate Resilience Inspired by Monsoon Culture' with Turenscape founder and 2023 Oberlander Prize...
text: anchor Lecture poster courtesy University of Waterloo School of Architecture The University of Waterloo’s School of Architecture has shared its Arriscraft Canada Brick Speaker Series information for the Fall 2024 semester.  Upcoming events include a panel discussion on 'Climate Resilience Inspired by Monsoon Culture' with Turenscape founder and 2023 Oberlander Prize winner Kongjian Yu on Thursday, October 24. Following that will be a discussion on creating public space with Class of 1999 BArch graduate Rosa Chang on Friday, November 1. Yale University's Mae-ling Lokko closes the term with a look at the potential for climate adaptation and bio-based materials on Thursday, November 21. Want to share your school's lecture series? Send us your poster and details to [email protected].
html:
• anchor

    Lecture poster courtesy University of Waterloo School of Architecture

    The University of Waterloo’s School of Architecture has shared its Arriscraft Canada Brick Speaker Series information for the Fall 2024 semester. 

    Upcoming events include a panel discussion on 'Climate Resilience Inspired by Monsoon Culture' with Turenscape founder and 2023 Oberlander Prize winner Kongjian Yu on Thursday, October 24. Following that will be a discussion on creating public space with Class of 1999 BArch graduate Rosa Chang on Friday, November 1. Yale University's Mae-ling Lokko closes the term with a look at the potential for climate adaptation and bio-based materials on Thursday, November 21.

    Want to share your school's lecture series? Send us your poster and details to [email protected].
